bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Thomas W. Grimes was postmaster and merchant of Greensboro, Georgia. He also worked as a clerk in the Greene County courts.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Business and routine correspondence of Thomas W. Grimes, including information on the shipment of goods from Augusta, Georgia, and the hiring of a enslaved man from Farish Carter, apparently an in-law of Grimes. A letter from William G. Grimes, Thomas's brother, describes a trip from Georgia to Washington, D.C. in 1827.
